headline: Honeywell Q2 guidance, Wells Fargo buyback, Altria earnings
summary: Yahoo Finance host Julie Hyman tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including Honeywell's (HON) second quarter forecasts, Wells Fargo's (WFC) announcement of a $40 billion stock buyback program, and tobacco company Altria (MO) reported better-than-expected first quarter adjusted earnings results. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Honeywell International (NasdaqGS:HON) Updates Earnings Guidance And Completes Share Buyback
summary: Honeywell International (NasdaqGS:HON) experienced a price increase of 3%, coinciding with significant corporate developments. The announcement of first-quarter results revealed a year-over-year revenue rise to $9,822 million, although net income slightly decreased. The company also updated its guidance, raising sales expectations, which likely supported market confidence. Additionally, Honeywell commenced a substantial stock buyback and declared a steady dividend, reinforcing shareholder...

headline: Honeywell faces $500 million tariff impact, but Kapur says mitigation in place
summary: Investing.com -- Honeywell International Inc (NASDAQ:HON) disclosed it expects up to $500 million in tariff-related exposure this year, largely driven by rising tensions with China, but its leadership expressed confidence that mitigation efforts will fully offset the impact. “We are confident we can fully offset the impact of current tariffs,” said CEO Vimal Kapur on the company’s first-quarter 2025 earnings call Tuesday.

raw.summary: Investing.com -- Honeywell International Inc (NASDAQ:HON) disclosed it expects up to $500 million in tariff-related exposure this year, largely driven by rising tensions with China, but its leadership expressed confidence that mitigation efforts will fully offset the impact. “We are confident we can fully offset the impact of current tariffs,” said CEO Vimal Kapur on the company’s first-quarter 2025 earnings call Tuesday.

headline: Why Honeywell Stock Is Up Today
summary: Honeywell International (NASDAQ: HON) reported first-quarter earnings that topped expectations and the company raised its full-year profit forecast.  Investors were pleased, sending Honeywell shares up 5% as of 10:30 am ET.  The company's backlog grew by 8%, led by strength in its building automation and energy units.

headline: Honeywell outlook, Adidas, Amazon & Trump: Trending Tickers
summary: Madison Mills and Explosive Options technical analyst Bob Lang examine some of the day's trending tickers on Yahoo Finance's platform during the trading session. Honeywell (HON) lifts its full-year outlook after its first quarter results beat expectations. Adidas (ADS.DE, ADDYY, ADS.HM) warns that tariffs will increase prices, opting not to raise its guidance despite a strong first quarter. Amazon (AMZN) is in the White House's crosshairs, as President Trump's Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt reacted to reports that the e-commerce giant will display the price increase associated with tariffs, saying it is "a hostile and political act." The Washington Post later reported that the company had debated making the move on its low-cost Amazon Haul site, not its main website. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here. This post has been updated to reflect new reporting.

raw.headline: Honeywell outlook, Adidas, Amazon & Trump: Trending Tickers
raw.summary: Madison Mills and Explosive Options technical analyst Bob Lang examine some of the day's trending tickers on Yahoo Finance's platform during the trading session. Honeywell (HON) lifts its full-year outlook after its first quarter results beat expectations. Adidas (ADS.DE, ADDYY, ADS.HM) warns that tariffs will increase prices, opting not to raise its guidance despite a strong first quarter. Amazon (AMZN) is in the White House's crosshairs, as President Trump's Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt reacted to reports that the e-commerce giant will display the price increase associated with tariffs, saying it is "a hostile and political act." The Washington Post later reported that the company had debated making the move on its low-cost Amazon Haul site, not its main website. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here. This post has been updated to reflect new reporting.

headline: Honeywell’s (NASDAQ:HON) Q1 Sales Beat Estimates
summary: Industrial conglomerate Honeywell (NASDAQ:HON) reported Q1 CY2025 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, with sales up 7.9% year on year to $9.82 billion. On the other hand, the company’s full-year revenue guidance of $40.05 billion at the midpoint came in 0.7% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.51 per share was 13.6% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: Honeywell’s (NASDAQ:HON) Q1 Sales Beat Estimates
raw.summary: Industrial conglomerate Honeywell (NASDAQ:HON) reported Q1 CY2025 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, with sales up 7.9% year on year to $9.82 billion. On the other hand, the company’s full-year revenue guidance of $40.05 billion at the midpoint came in 0.7% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.51 per share was 13.6% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: HONEYWELL REPORTS FIRST QUARTER RESULTS; UPDATES 2025 GUIDANCE
summary: Honeywell (NASDAQ: HON) today announced results for the first quarter that exceeded the company's guidance on all metrics. The company also maintained its full-year organic growth guidance, raised its adjusted earnings per share guidance range, and reiterated its free cash flow guidance range.
